Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2008 06:39AM MamaLaiste wrote: I stopped HRT in 1995 after the first lump was found.  That proved to be nothing, but with family HX, and being on Premarin for 12 years already, I wanted to take no chances.  Now 25 years later (after the hysterectomy) I do really good.  Once in a while maybe a hot flash, but never has been anything I can't tolerate.  The only issue I have is the loss of bone density.  Therese, my prayers are with you~

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 02:29PM MamaLaiste wrote: Hi Debbie~~  Thank you so much for sharing your story with me.  That's what I need to hear.  I really do know the standards of 80% being benign and so on, but I also know that there is every real possibility of me being in that 20%.  I had uterine cancer in May of 1983 and also a basal cell skin cancer in Feb of 1983. I know that I have seen this lump on the mammos and u/s in the past, but never had it been felt no matter how the dr's tried to feel it.  Now that it has actually been felt during a CBE, I feel that it is time to take it out.  I wasn't born with it, I don't want it growing inside me anymore-- no matter if it turns out benign or not. Maybe the doctor will decide to take it.
Posts.Title: Worriesome or not? MamaLaiste MamaLaiste

Posts.Content: MamaLaiste wrote: I'm not sure that I should even be here at this forum, but I figured it would be a good place to ask a couple of questions. A little background info would probably help ~~~ 1995 during a routine physical, my dr felt a possible lump and did an ultrasound. Didn't see anything so she sent me for a mammo because of family history (grandmother, aunt, 2 cousins all with BC) and it showed some areas to "watch". Kept going back yearly and things were rather boring. I tried to watch my dietary habits and be healthy. In 2002, my yearly mammo showed a small mass and microcalcifications. I went back 6 months later for another ultrasound and diagnostic mammo.... the ultrasound showed a possible small, non-fluid filled, mass and the mammo showed the mass had possibly grown slightly and another tight cluster. I was sent to a breast surgeon and we talked for a good hour. I was a very busy mom, and worked 2 fulltime jobs. Didn't have time for BC. The surgeon said it was a good possibility that it was just benign stuff and I asked what was the worst-case scenario. He said that *IF* it was a malignancy, that it was a very slow growing type and I probably had a good 10-12 years before any problems would come up. I decided to take those good 10-12 years and not biopsy or do anything. I continued with yearly mammos...... all very boring. Last Oct I went in for just a regular screening and it came back showing nothing. No mass, no microcalcifications, nothing. For the past 13 years, there has absolutely been no lumps or mass felt during a physical exam by myself or a doctor. Thursday I went in for a regular checkup with my doctor. New dr because I just moved to this area. She immediately felt "a nodule" at the 7 o'clock position (very near where I think the old films show the mass) and was concerned. I told her the past history and she said that this was serious and time to take care of it. She has set me up for a bilateral diagnostic mammo with ultrasound for this week and then gave me the information for the breast surgeon she is referring me to in the next town over from her. She told me about the procedure he does during surgery where he implants the medicine right into the breast. By that time, I was in tears and my head was spinning. My first reaction was that I really didn't want to hear anything about surgery or even a biopsy and I sure don't want to deal with treatments and such. I don't have the excuse of being too busy because of children at home, or a job anymore so I am going to go ahead and explore my options *IF* anything shows up this time. Anyway-- from all of your past experiences, do any of you think that I really may have anything to be concerned about? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Worriesome or not? MamaLaiste MamaLaiste

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 10:37AM MamaLaiste wrote: Thank you for the reply.  I've decided not to worry about it.  What will be, will be.
Posts.Title: Worriesome or not? MamaLaiste MamaLaiste

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2008 11:01AM MamaLaiste wrote: Well, the boobs are now pancakes!  Got the dx mammo yesterday and then the ultrasound.  The radiologist came in after the tech finished and he checked over the films.  He told me that there didn't appear to be any significant changes, and there were some changes that are normal to aging.  I felt really relieved and came home last night feeling good. This morning my PCP called and said they just got the results and that the report states that everything *appears* benign however, the radiologist wants me to follow up with the breast surgeon anyway. So, now I am waiting for that appointment to be set up.  I'm really not that worried at all-- I'm sure they just want me to meet this surgeon to have a sort of like "baseline" appointment to meet him.
Posts.Title: Worriesome or not? MamaLaiste MamaLaiste

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2008 01:55PM MamaLaiste wrote: ccchop, I have had micro-calcifications and a tiny mass that was found on mammos a few years ago... I chose not to biopsy at that time.  Last year, I was put on Evista as a precaution, took it for 2 months but my insurance wouldn't pay for any more of it and the dr ran out of samples so I no longer take it.  Durning that short period of time, I had no noticeble side effects.
